subject: Economics
title: Cryptocurrency Economics: Money Without Governments
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cryptocurrency Economics: Money Without Governments.

buildup.text: Cryptocurrency: money created by code, secured by cryptography, and governed by no government.

discovery.text: Bitcoin's fixed supply (21 million coins) mimics gold's scarcity.

twist.text: Bitcoin uses more electricity than Argentina. Its price is driven by speculation, not adoption.

climax.text: Crypto's economic innovation is real: programmable money, decentralized finance, borderless transfers.

punchline.text: Crypto asked: what if money didn't need governments? The answer is still.

quiz.question: What is the core economic innovation of cryptocurrency?
options: Enabling programmable, decentralized money that can be transferred borderlessly without requiring trust in any institution
